reviews.review: Игра однообразна и своих денег уж точно не стоит!

Portal 2 is a really good sequal. It has a lot of puzzles that's fun to find a way to beat the puzzles and beside that, it has a good story. If you haven't played the original portal then go buy it and play it before playing portal 2. Pretty much both the portal games are connected to the half life universe and I knew it was canon when they mentioned black mesa but we don't know if the portal series is at the same timeline as half life but in portal 2, it's like a loooong time after half life 2. If your the type of guy that likes puzzles or if your the type of guy that doesn't play puzzles, both portal games are just for you. I'm not a puzzle guy but after playing portal 1 and 2 made me interested of puzzles valve has but in these games. If you played portal 1 and wanting to play portal 2. Just go and buy it or if you never played portal 1 and just want to buy portal 2 then your gonna have to play portal 1 to get the picture while playing portal 2.
soooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo fun

Good.
As everyone else knows this game is a classic. It's short too which makes it easy to play in one sitting and not get distracted from.
Games that give that "Ah-hah i got it now" feeling can be some of the best you play. Beat it in about a day and a steal for $10.

A great classic to re experience years later, I picked up the Portal and Portal 2 bundle for $15. If you played this at release, liked it, and want to experience again definitely get it. If you are new to Portal and never played this before I would still recommend it for the fun story ( a bit short but worth it ) and great puzzles for its time. Now be a good test subject and proceed to the downloading phase.

I recommend it, but recommend portal 2 more.

Сюжет там это,механика там норм бла бла, главное у челл орешек зачетный 10\10
Что касается ачивок ,разрабы садисты и прохождения портала на 100% это призыв к мазохизму.Решил я его пройти с чем я столкнулся, проходишь "сложные уровни" ачивка может тебе присвоиться с 50% шансом, а почему никто не знает, или на золотые медали прохождение уровни.Разработчик придумал что ты чтобы уложился во время\кол-во порталов\шагов должен взять системный блок подставить его под углом перед дверьми который открывают лифт прыгнуть на красную кнопку ( не используя куб ) системный блок падает и ворота не закрываются далее ты ставишь портал и проходишь к лифту минуя 60% прохождения квеста,ЭТО ПРОСТО БОЖЕСТВЕННО,вот кто решил это сделать?))Или пройти уровни с малым кол-во шагов, ты должен как ниндзя ставить порталы и прыгать туда сюда не касаясь поверхности.Такое прохождение просто наизнанку классическое прохождение игры переворачивает,боюсь что будет в 2 части))

A série Portal sem dúvidas é uma das melhores ja feitas, o Portal 1 eu zerei em mais ou menos 3 horas, com 19 puzzles e alguns easter-eggs também. Os pontos fortes do jogo de longe da pra ver que é a dublagem e as mecanicas inovadoras de resolver puzzles com portais, a história do jogo te prende, mesmo o jogo tendo apenas 3-4 horas de duracao ele te prende e MUITO, fazendo parecer que se passam 10 horas, e isso é muito bom, ja na questao dos puzzles, nao tem o que falar muito, sao divertidos e um pouco dificeis, compre o jogo e aproveite cada parte, a dublagem, os personagens, os puzzles e os easter-eggs. The cake is a lie. 10/10

You know why...

Fun introduction to the Portal series. I had played Bridge Constructor Portal a little bit so the concept wasn't foreign to me but playing the main series game was far more fun. It took a little less than a day to beat the main game and I couldn't put it down the entire time. Man, level 19 is something else though. The escapes are tacked onto it but it felt like it would never end. It took about another day to grab all the achievements except the challenges. The challenges are SERIOUSLY hard even if you watch level walkthroughs from Portal god's on Youtube.

One complaint I do have is that I struggled with how to orient some of the portals and getting my bearings after teleporting through one. I wish there was a trainer that explained that in the beginning.
it is great i love it and dont forget the cake is a lie
good
very good game

Portal is a Classic that has earned it's reputation and is unmatched to this date in various different ways. 

The cleverly designed Portal Puzzling element/gameplay is such a smooth and responsive mechanic.
The levels and staging of Portal do a very good job at upping the difficulty every few puzzles or so without feeling too jarring or unwarranted. The fact that the concept of Portals goes from a very basic level of understanding to opening up a world of different possibilities of puzzles and problem-solving shows how cleverly developed and thought out the portalling system is.

The aesthetic of the game's "Aperture Science" is perfect as it feels futuristic and mysterious but also brings across a sense of realism. The mystery of the setting is amplified by the ominous robotic voice that guides you throughout the tests named "GLaDOS" that gives very vague advice and says some strange and downright confusing things, well... they're confusing on your first playthrough. There are also many other hidden elements/Easter Eggs in the facility that are just for fun and do hint at some Lore behind the story which has been expanded on exponentially by Valve and fans.

Without giving too much away, Portal is a unique and classic example of a great game that expands on a simple idea/concept and executes it perfectly. The setting is amazing and will leave you thinking constantly on your first playthrough as well as solving the different puzzles in your path. There is also a sequel non-surprisingly titled "Portal 2" that expands so much more on the Story and adds even more elements to the puzzles in major ways and executes this just as well as the first game, maybe even better.

So... Portal... 10/10, PLAY THIS NOW!
